meanings.definition: wheedlers: a person who uses flattery or charm to persuade someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The wheedlers at the party were always complimenting others to get what they wanted.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the wheedlers' sweet talk and knew they were just trying to manipulate her.
meanings.sent3: The wheedlers in the office were like smooth-talking salespeople, always trying to get their way.
meanings.sent4: The wheedlers in the fairy tale used their charm to trick the princess into giving them the magic key.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the wheedlers who pretend to be your friends just to get something from you.

meanings.definition: wheedlers: to persuade someone to do something through flattery or charm
meanings.sent1: He wheedlers his way into getting what he wants by complimenting others excessively.
meanings.sent2: She wheedlers her boss into giving her extra days off by always praising his decisions.
meanings.sent3: The children wheedlers their parents into buying them ice cream by promising to finish their homework.
meanings.sent4: The salesman wheedlers the customer into buying the expensive watch by highlighting its unique features.
meanings.sent5: She wheedlers the landlord into lowering the rent by always being cheerful and friendly.
